column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=And you think that they are equal ?
#Text=No , of course not .
#Text=You ’re saying in today ’s culture they are equal ?
#Text=Both can be famous .
#Text=That ’s not the kind of fame that I would want and the other kind of fame is a certain flavor of misery too because there ’s a trade-off that you lose your personal life .
#Text=I spent enough time in the fantasy world .
#Text=I do n’t watch reality shows .
#Text=These are the kind of people I could n’t wait to get away from in high school and I ’m going to chronicle their stupid adventures , you know ?
#Text=I do n’t live there .
#Text=I do n’t watch television .
#Text=I do n’t have cable , so I know how you feel .
#Text=Yeah , but even if I had cable , satellite , everything , I do n’t watch television .
#Text=I surround myself with things that edify me , not because it ’s there .
#Text=I ’m an information freak .
#Text=I ’m a news freak .
#Text=But it ’s got to be truthful news and that ’s why I ’ll go to the BBC News on the Internet .
#Text=There ’s less pressure with the truth teller over there .
#Text=It ’s amazing when you hear the BBC interview British politicians .
#Text=We find it shocking that they ’ll say things like “ Are n’t you essentially lying when you say that ? ”
#Text=But that was the Fourth Estate .
#Text=That was the idea that you owe your readers .
#Text=You ’ve been entrusted to deliver news to them and even if it ’s an editorial or an interview , the idea is to get as much true information so people can decide for themselves .
#Text=I do n’t care if the interviewer ’s biased .
#Text=If I get enough information , I have a chance to be biased or not .
#Text=That 's an argument on Wikipedia : people make the argument , ' let 's present the information out there and let the reader decide .
#Text=Yeah , but if a lot of times the information is totally incorrect to begin with .
#Text=Exactly , and it can be difficult to decide what to believe when reasonable minds can differ , but I think it 's very problematic to ever argue " just let the reader decide . "
#Text=I do n't know if Wikipedia is the place for that fight , but in the news media , that is the place for the fight .
#Text=I interviewed Gay Talese , who quoted Norman Mailer who said the media is like a donkey , and you must feed the donkey every day ; the donkey will eat anything : garbage , tin cans , slop .
#Text=And report on whatever they are fed .
#Text=Billy West on telling it like it is
#Text=Are your voices an attempt to understand reality ?
